servinfo.title: DTC P0031 / P0032: HO2S Heater Control Circuit Low / High (Sensor-1)

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P0030: HO2S Heater Control Circuit (Sensor-1) .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Heater control circuit voltage of A/F sensor is lower than specification for more than specified time continuously even though control duty ratio of A/F sensor heater is less than 90% with engine running. (Heater control duty pulse is not detected in its circuit of ECM)

Heater control circuit voltage of A/F sensor is higher than specification for more than specified time continuously even though control duty ratio of A/F sensor heater is more than 10% with engine running. (Heater control duty pulse is not detected in its circuit of ECM)

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC using scan tool.
Start engine and warm up to normal operating temperature.
Run engine at idle speed for 1 min. or more.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions For DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from A/F sensor with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection to A/F sensor connector.
If connection are OK, measure voltage between heater power terminal of A/F sensor connector and vehicle body ground with ignition switch turned ON.

testgroup.title: HO2S heater fuse check
testgroup.question: Is “O2 HTR” fuse in good condition?

testgroup.title: A/F sensor and HO2S heater resistance check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from HO2S-2 with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check heater resistance of A/F sensor and HO2S referring to Air Fuel Ratio (A/F) Sensor On-Vehicle Inspection and Heated Oxygen Sensor (HO2S-2) Heater On-Vehicle Inspection .

testgroup.question: Are A/F sensor heater and HO2S heater in good condition?

testgroup.title: HO2S heater relay power circuit check

test1.ptxt: Remove integration relay No.2 (for J20 engine) (1) or HO2S heater relay (for M16 engine) (2) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection to relay connector.
If connection are OK, measure voltage between each relay power terminal of relay connector and vehicle body ground with ignition switch tuned ON.

testgroup.question: Is each measured voltage 10 – 14 V?

test1.ptxt: Check integration relay No.2 (for J20 engine) or HO2S heater relay (for M16 engine) referring to Control Relay Inspection .
Measure insulation resistance between heater terminals of A/F sensor connector.

testgroup.title: HO2S heater relay circuit check

test1.ptxt: Measure wire resistance between coil ground terminal of relay connector and vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is measured resistance lower than 1 Ω?

action.ptxt: Output wire of relay connector is open or short to ground.

testgroup.title: A/F sensor heater check

test1.ptxt: Check heater resistance of A/F sensor referring to Air Fuel Ratio (A/F) Sensor On-Vehicle Inspection .

testgroup.question: Is A/F sensor heater in good condition?

testgroup.title: A/F sensor heater control circuit check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection of A/F sensor heater circuit terminal to ECM connector.
If connection are OK, measure each wire resistance of sensor heater control circuit at ECM connector between ECM to A/F sensor and ECM to vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is each measured wire resistance lower than 1 Ω?

action.ptxt: Repair or replace defective wire circuit.

test1.ptxt: Measure insulation resistance between control terminal of A/F sensor heater and ground terminal of A/F sensor heater at ECM connector.

action.ptxt: Substitute a known good ECM and recheck.
